description: An ancient settlement located in the Hejaz of modern Saudi Arabia.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Meda'in Salih. The Al-Hijr Archaeological Site (Madâin Sâlih), a site connected with the pre-Islamic Nabatean kingdom, was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2008.

names.romanized: Mada'in Salih, Madain Salih, Mada'in Saleh, Madā'in Sālih, Madā'in Sāleh, Meda'in Salih, Meda'in Saleh, Madâin Sâlih, Madâ'in Sâlih, Medâin Sâleh, Medâ'in Sâleh, Madain Salich, eOGFf UGdM, mdA}n SAlH, mdʾˈn ṣʾlḥ

names.description: An inscription found at Mada'in Salih, dating between A.D. 175 and 177, records the restoration of a vallum undertaken by the civitas Hegrenorum, on behalf of the emperor Marcus Aurelius. Cooley et al. note that this provides evidence for Roman soldiers at this site prior to the Severan period.

references.formattedCitation: Alföldy, Géza, and Christian Witschel, eds. Epigraphic Database Heidelberg. Heidelberg: Heidelberg Academy of Sciences and Humanities, 1997. http://edh-www.adw.uni-heidelberg.de/.
